intro: Centaurium minus var. austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian lesser centaury, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing blue to violet flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a relatively rare species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
